body.S: A great way to eat healthy is to eat foods that are fresh and natural, like vegetables, fruits, nuts, beans, or fish. Is there a healthy, natural food you would like to eat today?
Vegetables are the healthiest food group by far. Try to eat some vegetables with each meal today if you can!
The hungrier we are when choosing food, the harder it can be to choose a healthy option. If you can, try to plan your meals ahead of time when you aren't feeling hungry!
Stress can have a harmful effect on your physical health over time. Today, when you feel worried, try taking deep, slow breaths and focus your attention only on what is within your control to change.
It can be helpful to remember that almost everyone you meet is facing some kind of internal struggle. Today, try to be especially kind and understanding to othersâ€¦and to yourself!
Making a list of your favorite healthy foods and having them easily available at home can help keep you on track in terms of a healthy diet. Can you make a list of your favorite healthy foods today?
The simplest way to improve your diet is to fill your plate with more vegetables for each meal. Try to increase the amount of vegetables you eat this week by 20%!
Be careful of foods like white bread that are made of simple carbohydrates. Try to use foods rich in complex carbohydrates instead like whole wheat breads, whole grain crackers, or brown rice!
Some fats are actually good for you! Olive oil, soybeans, nuts, or avocados are all examples of healthy fats.
It is a good idea to avoid foods with "partially hydrogenated" oils listed as an ingredient. Partially hydrogenated oils can be found in certain types of synthetic butters or other processed foods!
Fish is generally healthier than red meats like beef. Try to add more fish into your diet for a healthier future!
A good cooking tip is to season foods with herbs and spices instead of salt. Your food will still be tasty but will be much healthier as well!
Today's nutrition tip for a healthy heart: stay away from any foods that contain more than 140mg of sodium (salt) per serving!
Some canned or processed foods can contain high levels of salt. Look for sodium on the nutrition information label and be careful if it says there are more than 140mg of sodium per serving!
Here is a healthy eating tip: try to have fresh fruit for dessert instead of baked goods, puddings, or sweets made with cream or sauces!

It can be difficult to eat healthy foods when ordering from fast food restaurants. This week, try to limit the number of times you eat fast food this week and replace these meals with healthier alternatives!
Some of the best choices for healthy protein include beans, fish, egg whites, tofu/soy, and nuts. Try to have one of these great protein sources this week!
Write down your three favorite vegetables and buy one of them today to snack on during the week!
Physical activity can lower blood pressure and "bad" cholesterol levels and can help you lose weight. Try to find a way to be active today!

It possible, try using positive self-talk to turn negative thoughts into more positive ones. For example, when you catch yourself thinking, "I can't do this," try saying "I'll do the best I can" instead!
To help reduce stress and promote relaxation, try taking 15 to 20 minutes today to sit quietly, relax, breathe deeply in a peaceful environment. Notice how you feel afterward!
Reducing physical tension in your body can help alleviate mental tension as well. Try to walk, bike, do yoga, or exercise in another way to help calm your mind today!
If walking was a medication, doctors would write prescriptions for it all the time! Take a walk today for its many health benefits.
Delete - duplicate
Today, try to reach for healthy foods first when you are hungry instead of indulging in less healthy, comfort foods!
